stories.title: On NYT Magazine on AI: Resist the Urge to Be Impressed

stories.text:
Hi folks,

I'm a JS dev and I would like to learn a new language. Probably Python or Go.

How did you learn a new programming language as an experienced dev? What was your approach?

Do you know an interactive website that explains different language features or design patterns using JS code fragments and their Python / Go equivalents?

It seems like a good approach to shorten my learning curve. Unfortunately, I didn't find a good one so far.

Thx.
stories.title: Ask HN: How did you learn a new programming language as an experienced dev?

stories.text: This could be optional so I doubt anyone will mind.
stories.title: Ask HN: Why don't podcast apps fix speech impediments (e.g., lisps) using AI?

stories.text: I have been learning JavaScript for over a year now and thought I'd try combining my new skill with animation/design, so I made this personal website with interactive animations made with Rive.
stories.title: Show HN: Personal Website with Rive Animations
